ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Atmospheric ozone observation with millimeter-wave spectroscopic radiometer at Rio Gallegos, Argentina
ResourceHeader.Description: Atmospheric vertical ozone profiles from 14 to 80 km retrived from continuous ground-based millimeter-wave (110 GHz) measurements at Rio Gallegos, Argentina. Further details of the instrument, data processing and error analysis appear in Ohyama et al. (in preparation).
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: The millimeter-wave spectroscopic radiometer at OAPA (Atmospheric Observatory of Austral Patagonia) in Rio Gallegos, Argentina is operated by ISEE, Nagoya University, Japan as a part of the JICA/JST SATREPS project (PI; Akira Mizuno). The OAPA site is operated by CEILAP (Laser and Applications Research Center), Argentina. For data use, please contact the PI (Akira Mizuno at mizuno [at] isee.nagoya-u.ac.jp) for the details. We thank the support staffs of the Lidar Division of CEILAP and ISEE/GRC for their efforts.
